description: Fires when a specific custom event occurs, typically pushed via data layer (window.dataLayer/window._mtm) or emitted by your app. Use it to react to business events like form submission, purchase, signup, etc.

when_to_use: You push application events into the data layer and want to trigger tags on those events
You need to track granular business actions (e.g., purchase, signup, lead_created)
You want to migrate from GTM custom events to Piwik PRO
common_use_cases: custom_event from SPA routers or internal app events
best_practices: Use consistent event naming conventions (snake_case or kebab-case)
Document expected event payload structure for your team
Create dedicated variables to extract event name/properties from the data layer
Test events in the browser console before publishing

create_trigger.description: Create a new event trigger using this template.

app_id.description: UUID of your Piwik PRO app

name.description: Descriptive name for the event trigger

conditions.description: Array of condition objects that determine when the event trigger fires

trigger_type.edit_note: ‚ö†Ô∏è Cannot be changed after trigger creation

conditions.description: Array of condition objects that define when the event trigger should fire

common_variables.event_property: Data layer variable pointing to a payload field (e.g., 'ecommerce.action')

event_name_equals.description: Fire on a specific event name

event_name_pattern.description: Fire on events following a naming pattern
event_name_pattern.variable_type: Data Layer variable for event name

event_property_check.description: Fire based on event payload property
event_property_check.variable_type: Data Layer variable for payload field (e.g., 'ecommerce.action')

purchase_completed_event.use_case: Fire conversion tags when a purchase completes

lead_created_event_with_property.description: Trigger on lead_created with channel property set to 'paid'

common_mistakes: Using an event name variable that doesn't reflect your data layer structure
Relying on properties that are not always present in the payload
Removing or reusing condition_id values incorrectly when editing existing conditions (creation auto-generates them)

possible_causes: Data layer push occurs after trigger evaluation or not on the expected page
Variable IDs point to the wrong data layer paths
debugging_steps: Verify data layer pushes in browser console (window.dataLayer or window._mtm)
Log pushed events and payload structure to confirm fields
Test conditions with simpler 'equals' or 'contains' first
Ensure the variable returns the expected value
